Name: Green Guardians
Description:
Green Guardians is a strategic resource management game based on the scarcity, risk, and cost-benefit of natural resource use. Green Guardians is inspired by the precious natural world around us that is being irreparably altered through climate change and habitat destruction. The challenge for the Guardians is to find the balance of seeking prosperity without polluting the world beyond recovery.

Green Guardians is a strategic game for 2-4 players, recommended for ages 10 and up, and after a quick setup lasts 45-60 minutes. Players' choices drive the action and competition but random events provide an extra challenge.

Guardians explore the undiscovered world to gather resources. The resources can be used to build and upgrade to structures that provide additional resources and research. However their actions create waste that accumulates over time to form pollution that prevents the structures from working. In addition, the use of resources subjects the Guardians to disasters that slow down their progress. Guardians overcome these challenges by using their resources to research abilities and cleanup the pollution to keep their buildings productive.

—description from the publisher

Name: Indommus: Reyes Destronados
Description:
GAME SYSTEM

    
    
         This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.

    



Put yourself in the shoes of a monarch, who must dethrone another king to ensure his power and conquer.

Indommus is a collectible card game where you will have different types of cards to build your deck and develop a strategy that leaves your opponent out of the game.

Each player has 40 life points, and will achieve victory by leaving his opponent at 0 life points. However, it is also possible to win the battle by leaving your opponent with no cards in his deck.

The Indommus card system modifies the current standards of Trading Card Games, by not having a rarity system, allowing all players to easily get their cards.

Defeat your opponent and become the most powerful monarch on the continent.

—description from the designer

Name: Girts & Girders
Description:
Roll & write game for two players in 30 minutes where you build railroad bridges. The players take turns in casting and selecting dice combinations by which they can either build new parts for bridges or create demand between cities looking to cross those bridges. The player that first finishes a given bridge gets the points for all traffic passing over it.

—description from the designer

Name: The Gloom Chronicles
Description:
Take a journey through the miserable world of GLOOM!

In Gloom, you and your friends weave tales of woe. But where does the story begin? Each of the twenty cards in The Gloom Chronicles sets a unique foundation for a game of Gloom, and variant rules add new challenges to the story. You can choose a card at random, or you can start at the beginning and explore the ongoing fate of your family through an extended campaign. Your story begins with the Unhappy Birthday… but will your next game of Gloom involve a tragic train ride, or will you end up at the infamous World’s Unfair?

The Gloom Chronicles is an expansion that can enhance any game of Gloom. Narrative prompts give players a unified foundation for their stories, while variant rules challenge new and experienced players alike. The Unhappy Birthday awaits: where will your Gloom Chronicle end?

—description from the publisher

Name: High Frontier 4 All: 6th Player Component Kit
Description:
All the components needed to play the High Frontier 4 All core game, module 1, and module 2 as a 6-player game.

—description from the publisher

Name: That's So Nerdy
Description: Get your geek on with the That's So Nerdy Quiz. 1000 fantastically geeky trivia cards for boffins everywhere! Team up for a battle of brains! Can mix and match with other Ridley's collection trivia games.

Name: Saturday Night Live: The Game
Description:
Play through a series of classic and iconic SNL sketches. Everyone is in the same sketch together except for one player, the Stand-In. The Stand-In’s goal is to figure out the sketch by playing along and improvising. The rest of the players are trying to figure out who the Stand-In is without giving away too much.

After an agreed upon amount of time, all players point to who they think is the stand-in. The player with the majority of votes then reveals their identity by showing their card to the group.  If the player is NOT the stand-in, the actual stand-in reveals their identity and collects 2 scoring tokens. Also, any player that did point to that player scores 1 token. If the player is the stand-in, then any player pointing to them scores 1 token. The stand-in still has one chance to score by guessing the sketch everyone was in. If they are correct, they score 1 token. The first player to collect 5 scoring tokens wins!

It takes timing, deduction, bluffing, and acting skills to win! The game features 30 different all-time favorite sketches including More Cowbell, The Roxbury Guys, The Ladies Man, and more!

Game includes 210 Sketch Cards of 30 Sketches, 7 Stand-In Cards, 30 Sketch Envelopes, 1 Stand-In Envelope, 36 Scoring Tokens, 8 SNL Reference Boards, 60 Second Sand Timer, Game Instructions

Name: Kabuki: A game of secret objectives
Description:
In Kabuki, players try to accomplish secret objectives by playing, removing and rearranging different characters on the game board. Some of your opponents’ objectives may coincide with your own, while others will certainly work against you. Figure out your rival’s goals while keeping your own a secret long enough to win out.

While the game mechanics are simple to learn, Kabuki offers rich strategy and intense competition through a mix of subtlety, sabotage and misdirection.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stock Market: The Game of the Century
Description:
Self-published by Joseph E. Kochmar of East Mauch Chunk, Pennsylvania in 1937.

Board is similar in appearance to Monopoly, but with 1930s-era US companies as “properties”. Two colored areas in the middle identify “bull” or “bear” cards to be drawn.

Name: Zombicide: Invader – CMON Comics - Vol. 1 Promos
Description:
New additions to the game included with the Kickstarter edition of the 128-page "Dead Contact" graphic novel.

6 new survivor figures and ID cards:
-Harrison Kane, Captain
-Daphne Connor, Commander
-Oleg Bogrov, Lieutenant
-Yuko Tanaka, Sergeant
-PRO.MO.D (Programmed Modular Defender)
-Empusa, Shapeshifter

-Stepmother’s Colony Mini Campaign
-Stepmother Abomination figure and cards

Name: Ages of Conflict
Description:
Ages of Conflict is a multi-genre, or universal, tabletop miniatures war game. This is a game of mass battle in which you command an army with the goal of smashing your enemy into ruin. Ages of Conflict employs a flexible system allowing you to create units and armies from nearly any time and genre, including ancients, fantasy, black powder, and science fiction.

Scale Agnostic: Ages of Conflict treats the miniatures as representations of the soldiers in the unit allowing you to use any scale miniatures you prefer - 2 mm, 3 mm, 6 mm, 10 mm, 15 mm, 28 mm, etc.

Multi-Genre: One set of rules to battle with historical, fantasy, black powder, World War II, and sci-fi. This means you can also mix genres allowing you to fight an army of American Civil War Confederates against undead, a World War II Allied force against alien invaders, and so on. This does not mean the armies will be equal.

Army Lists: The Ages of Conflict core book includes over 50 historical army lists spanning the ancient world to the early Renaissance, 20 fantasy army lists, and close to 30 black powder army lists from the Seven Years War, the American War of Independence, the Napoleonic Wars, the Crimean War, and the American Civil War.

Customizable: Use your favorite miniatures and bases you already have. Uses a large variety of miniature manufacturers including MicroWorld, Baccus, Essex, Irregular, Victrix, Perfect Six, Old Glory, 2d6, and more. You can also use a variety of basing standards: 60 x 30 mm, 40 x 40 mm, 40 x 20 mm, etc.

Fast Paced: Minimal book keeping and alternating actions keep you engaged and the game moving at a brisk pace. There are no result tables to reference with each roll. Once you learn the turn sequence the only information you reference is your army roster sheet.

Solo Play: While not strictly designed for solo play, Ages of Conflict does play perfectly well as a solo game and includes guidelines for playing Ages of Conflict in solo mode.

-description from Kickstarter campaign

Name: Spatzen unterm Hut
Description:
The players gets 12 tokens and place their hats according to the rules into the slots on the game board. Then the game board is rotated two steps. 
The red player begins and points at a white hat on the game board and shouts: "Sparrow under the hat!" If this ist true, the owner of the hat has to pay 1 token into the cash box. If not, the active player has to pay 1 token to the hat owner. After this the game board is rotated one step and the white player gets his turn to accuse the black-white player to have sparrows under his hat.

If a player has lost all his tokens he is out of the game. The last player with any tokens left wins the game and the contents of the cash box.

—user summary

Name: Iron Helm: Adventure Pack #6 – Malicia's Refuge
Description:
Malicia's Refuge is the 6th Adventure Pack for Iron Helm that adds all new Loot, Skills, Trappings, Plots, a new Boss to fight, and a new Character to play as. You will need to own the base game of Iron Helm to play this expansion.

Malicia's Refuge is a level three Adventure Pack meaning it is to be incorporated with the base game as your third adventure if you survive the base game and a level two adventure pack.

Name: Starcadia Quest: CMON Comics – Vol. 1 Promos
Description:
New additions to the game included with the Kickstarter edition of the 68-page "Heart of a Star" graphic novel, an exclusive edition of the 3 Starcadia Quest issues published by IDW.

-12 Promo Quests:
The 12 Promo Quests from the paperback issues will come printed as proper cards to match your other Starcadia Quest cards! These cards bring 3 new Scenarios for you to experience the stories of the comic directly on the tabletop:

-Happy Birthday, Starkid
-To Teklawn
-The Thorne Offensive

-4 Kickstarter Exclusive Upgrade tokens:
2 new items introduced in the comics: the M.E.D.A.L. communicator and the Vacupack Jittters snack! As Level 1 Deck upgrades, players will be able to add these to their mix after completing their first Scenario.

Coveted by beginner crews, the M.E.D.A.L. communicator is a useful tool to give you an edge over the competition. By itself, it can help boost ranged attacks, but when close to a Computer Terminal, where it can receive data, its boost is greatly increased!

The Vacupack Jitters is famous not only for its addictive taste but also for the energy rush it can induce! Bringing one along can allow your Hero to react quickly, gaining extra defense and reroll!

--description from publisher

Name: Paris: Eiffel
Description:
The tower built by architect Gustave Eiffel rises high above Paris, announcing the inauguration of the Universal Exposition. There are those who define it as a monstrous iron cyclops and others as the first step into modern architecture. There is no doubt it will leave very few indifferent.

Paris Eiffel is an expansion of Paris: La cité de la lumière. There are eight new action postcards that provide far more variability in the game. The postcards are accompanied by a series of die-cut figures that will add a spectacular third dimension to your Paris.

In this expansion you will visit Parisian marvels such as the Arc de Triomphe, the obelisk of Luxor, Louvre Museum, and naturally, the Eiffel Tower.

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: Honey Hunt
Description:
Lead your bees in this race to get more honey than your opponent. Will you be the first to get 10 honey drops?

You will control two worker bees to collect the pollen and drop it into the honeycomb. Then, use your two drones to collect the honey and prevent other workers from crossing. Also, don't miss the queen: she can either help you or your opponent.

Honey Hunt is a game for two players where each player will try to reach first the honey to win the game.

Name: No-Go for Juniors
Description:
The game board is a Mexican street track with a start and finish line and a 4x10 grid for a maximum of four players and a track length of 10 spaces. Players take turns shaking two custom dice in a dice cup.

If the dice spell GO, all players try to grab the dice showing a G. The player who grabs it first gets to move his car token one space forward. If the dice spell NO, the dice must not be touched. Any player who touched either dice backs up one car length.

The first player whose car token crosses the finish line is the winner.

Name: Critical Fail
Description:
Critical Fail is a Fill-In-The-Blank Party Game for RPG Lovers.

Imagine Cards Against Humanity had a Safe-for-Work dragon-baby with D&D. That is how you get Critical Fail. Players take turns reading prompt cards and playing response cards.

The Ranger caught dinner. Hope you like __________.

     The Paladins mount
     A level 16 Goblin
     Orphans... Lots of orphans


It's normal to panic when the GM mentions __________.

     Fall Damage
     Blank Character Sheets
     Fireball and more Fireball


—description from the designer

Name: Rovers van de Noordzee: Promodeck
Description:
An authorized promo deck for the Dutch market that contains a selection of 25 cards from the North Sea Runesaga expansion and 5-Year Anniversary Promo Cards.

3 Outsider:
- Invader
- Scout
- Thief

3 Hero:
- Constantin
- Girard
- Jorunn

19 Townfolk:
- Artisan x3
- Assassin x3
- Beggar x2
- Blacksmith x2
- Conspirator x3
- Farmer x2
- Thief x2
- Tyrant x2
Families: Series: The North Sea Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Zoo Cards
Description:
Card kit to play with your group of friends. Agility, concentration and memory you will need to win. This game is perfect for family fun. Go ahead and buy it now!

A card KIT to play 10 totaly diferents fun family games. From 2 to 15 players

Name: A Battle of Onin
Description:
A Battle of Onin is a strategic trick-taking card game, designed for between 2-4 players. It offers some mechanics reminiscent of classic games such as Spades, Euchre, Pinochle and Hearts, but with incredibly nuanced gameplay.

How to play: 
13 cards are dealt to each player. Each player sets a bid for how many tricks they'll try to win; high card wins the trick! Collect too many tricks and over time you will become corrupted and your influence will suffer.  Collect too few tricks and you won't keep up with your adversaries! Strategize with your enemies to survive; you may have to make risky decisions in the process. But remember, allegiances change rapidly. Score the most influence points to win without being negatively affected by your corruption.

What separates A Battle of Onin from other traditional trick-taking games?

A reimagined 52 card deck along with familiar mechanics offers a new challenge for experienced trick-takers; while players who are unfamiliar with the genre will learn with ease.

With a cohesive blend of subtle complexity, cooperative elements, and unique strategies, A Battle of Onin requires the ability to play offensively and defensively simultaneously; as every hand can and must be strategized to your advantage...even the "bad" hands.

A Battle of Onin is designed to be color-blind friendly. For players who are colorblind, we have kanji symbols denoting color and faction; Featuring four unique characters that are easily distinguishable. Provided is a key to help translate the symbols and play seamlessly.

Because we know that skill levels vary, what makes this game stand apart from the rest is it's malleability. A Battle of Onin is Modular. We encourage you to play the multiple variants of gameplay we detail that fit your skill/enjoyment level. From basic, to advanced to expert mode. We also encourage you to implement your own ideas and house rules to maximize your fun-factor. Be creative and make the game as enjoyable as possible!

Beyond all that is the ease it takes to learn, set up, shuffle up and play. Though it takes minutes to learn, new players can play competitively almost immediately.  This gives A Battle of Onin re-playability. Most of the time, we don't just play one game. We play 2 or 3.

—description from the designer

Name: Outpaced
Description:
Storyline:

Scientists now knew it was the end of the world. They predicted that a scourge of natural disasters would hit the earth getting increasingly more dangerous until they wiped out all life on earth. The nation's government leaders came up with a solution to build a giant government facility larger than any structure on earth capable of withstanding these natural disasters and producing all the energy they needed to sustain human life. Taxes rose drastically that year as the nation's people raced to outpace the disasters and finish the massive project. It was finished with almost no time to spare but, that was when the government announced that the citizens who paid for the construction were not allowed to stay in the bunker. The now corrupt government even kicked citizens out of the main city and built a wall protecting it so that the government could hoard the cities valuable resources. You are in charge of a small group of survivors that were kicked out of the city and the disasters start tomorrow. Your only chance to survive the end of the world which is happening in only a few weeks is to break into the government facility and overthrow the government. In the meantime, though you will have to build makeshift bunkers using resources to protect yourself against natural disasters, get valuable provisions to keep your survivors alive, and repair weapons, vehicles, and tools to improve your chance of survival and help you defend yourself against other groups of survivors looking to overthrow the government before you do. This is Outpaced.

Gameplay: 
Each round is split into three phases. Exploration, Fortification, and Catastrophe.

In the exploration phase players have 1 minute indicated by a timer to quickly roll dice that allow players to move around the city, collect resource cards from various locations, destroy gates that allow players to access more of the map, and make it back to their bunker before the timer runs out if players don’t make it back to the bunker in time they lose 1 of their five lives and all of their resources from the natural disaster that occurs in the catastrophe phase.

In the fortification phase players take turns spending their resources to fortify their bunker, buy more dice, and/or craft builds like weapons, vehicals, and tools to gain an advantage in the game.

In the catastrophe phase players draw a disaster card. The disaster card weakens players bunkers and destroys various locations on the map effecting gameplay in the next round. If the disaster destroys your bunker you will also lose one of your 5 lives.

Disasters will get increasingly harder every round until all players die or a player destroys all the gates on the map and breaks into the governments bunker in the center of the map.

If more than one player makes it to the government facility it turns into a battle where the player that rolls the most combat dice wins the game.

-description from designer

Name: Kabuto Sumo: Insect All-Stars
Description:
A new Sumo-Beya (stable of wrestlers) joins the league, the Insect All-Stars. This diverse cast of wrestlers makes the matches even more viscous and unpredictable. The giant beetles will have to adapt to these new aggressive challengers if they want to continue to be the last one standing in the ring.

This expansion adds 8 new wrestlers you may use in your games of Kabuto Sumo, each with a new signature piece. When players start a new game they may choose their wrestling persona from either the original wrestlers or any expansion wrestlers.

Some of these wrestlers use multiple copies of their signature piece. When using these wrestlers all copies of their signature piece are available to be gained and used in the same game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Forest Adventure
Description:
Forest Adventure is a new game what take you to new level of gaming.
The game has multiple difficulty levels, from child mode to strategic mode.

Two playing way!

1.Movement by Dice:

The game is started by the player who rolls the most dice. Successive players move clockwise.

If more than one player is on the same space, nothing happens. After completing your move, if you are standing on a square with a crate, take a card from the deck of adventure cards and follow the instructions on the card. If you stood on the action space, you execute the command from that space.

Rolling 6 points each time entitles you to extra move. Only rolling a different number of spots ends the turn.

2.Movements cards:

On strategic mode you use movement cards to move around the board - cards marked with dice.
This will give you connection between board game and card game with new oportunity of gameplay.


You went on a trip with friends. After setting up the camp, it turned out that on the way you lost a basket with provisions.
Additionally, one of the backpacks was torn and protective equipment against insects and other items helpful during the trip fell out of it.
You decide to find the lost basket with food in order to play by the camp fire in the evening.

The forest is full of surprises. You can stand face to face with a dangerous bear or meet poisonous snakes on your way.
However, not all obstacles are dangerous, be careful not to get distracted and get lost while listening to the beautiful voice of singing birds.
During the journey, you will also meet harmless animals, observing them and not disturbing them can help you find your way faster.
You will also have to cross dangerous canyons and swamps.

Some facts about the game, I think you should love it  :

Game rules

The game is started by the player who rolls the most dice. Successive players move clockwise.
If more than one player is on the same space, nothing happens. After completing your move, if you are standing on a square with a crate, take a card from the deck of adventure cards and follow the instructions on the card. If you stood on the action space, you execute the command from that space.
Rolling 6 points each time entitles you to extra move. Only rolling a different number of spots ends the turn.
To complete the game, in the last move you need to roll as many stitches as you have left to the basket.

Difficulty level

With this game you can play on several difficult levels what make game more interested and tageted to everyone.
You can play with your yungest child 3+ or play with advanced players in strategic, coop or rivalry mode using standard dice or movement card.
The game can take 10 minutes on child mode or even couple hour on maximum difficulty level.

Normal level - Variant 1

In the basic variant of the game, the difficulty level is on the normal level - 5/10.

You play in classic style:
throw the dice -> move -> get the card if you stand on field with chest -> follow the instruction -> end turn

The length of the game oscillating about 15-30 minutes but depends on the player's luck and skill in throwing the dice, meetings with forest inhabitants and the collected equipment.

Some of example other level in game:

Child mode

Difficulty level - 1/10
This is the fastest game timeand can take 10 minute or less. This level is for everyone who want fast end or have children who can't sit on place more than 10 minute
The goal of the game is to reach the finish line as quickly as possible. You don't use any cards, all action spaces are neutral and nothing happens on them. The crossroads are also neutral, and you choose your own direction of travel. If your move ends in a space that has been occupied by another player, you occupy the next empty space.

Meeting mode

Difficulty level - 6/10
You win only when collect all animals you will meet - 15 animals - one card per each. You take adventure cards from the pile of cards only after you have finished moving on the field with the box.
But be careful, if you lose on action fields - ants, bees, swamp, rock pillar, suspension bridge and ponds, you lose all collected card.
When you end your move on basket with food, next turn you will begin on camp and lose all equipment cards and map card.
All your lost cards you need to return the bottom of the pile of cards.

Card mode - strategic

Difficulty level – 9/10
This mode offers the possibility of strategic thinking and planning, but the game time increases significantly, so it is recommended for players who like the highest level of difficulty in games.
In this mode, you play the base game.
During the game, you only use the dice when you encounter animals. In this mode, you use movement cards to move around the board - cards marked with dice.
At the beginning of the game, shuffle the movement cards and deal 5 cards to all players so that the other players cannot see them. Leave the rest of the cards on the pile.

During your turn, you may use one of your cards to move and reveal it to the players. However, if neither card meets your strategic plans, you choose the first move card in the pile, which ultimately determines your move.
Each used movement card is returned to the bottom of the movement deck.
After you have used all your movement cards, on the next turn, you take the first 5 cards from the pile and continue the game.

Name: Koinz
Description:
Simple coin (Koin) stacking, area control game.  Players alternate playing Koinz onto 1-4 Surfaces with the goal of capturing each Surface by accumulating the most points on that Surface.  The first player to capture five Surfaces wins.  Each round takes about five minutes.  Players get to choose how many Koinz and surfaces are used in each round and strategy will change based on these choices.

This game was released in July 2022.

-description from designer

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Death Guard
Description:
The Death Guard are the greatest champions of the Plague God, Grandfather Nurgle, his favoured spreaders of his bounteous gifts. Look upon them and see the signs: pus seeping from festering wounds that never heal; miasmic smogs of corrosive, stinking gas hanging thickly in the air wherever Nurgle’s chosen tread; the wriggling, lamprey-mouthed tick-leeches that clamp on to their rotting flesh; the droning billions of plague flies that swarm the battlefields they stalk and the ships in which they course through the stars.

Few armies offer such a rich canvas for painting and modelling as the Death Guard. Every miniature is riddled with gruesome details and grisly flourishes, showing the blessings they have received from Nurgle, and in turn how they will spread the Lord of Decay’s infections. With them you can craft a truly head turning – not to mention stomach turning – force that can terrify your enemies and be disgustingly powerful on the battlefield. This book is the ultimate guide to the Death Guard, featuring in depth lore and background and the rules that you need to field them in Warhammer 40,000.

Inside this book, you'll find:

– Background on the reunification of Mortarion with the Death Guard during the Great Crusade, his eventual fall into heresy, and the process inflicted upon the Death Guard as Nurgle's Destroyer Plague took them.
– Information on the organisational structure of the Death Guard following the Horus Heresy and how their cohesion meant they were better able to enact war upon the galaxy.
– Incredible photography of units, single miniatures, and armies on terrain, both on their own and as part of battle scenes.
– Datasheets that cover every unit fieldable by a Death Guard army.
– Death Guard-specific Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Relics, and psychic powers.
– In-depth Crusade rules that let you grow your force as it spreads diseases and plague across the galaxy.
– And more!

Name: Oppai Go: Fantastic Breasts and Where to Find Them
Description:
The success of the Oppai Go tournament has even reached the realm of Tengu, animal gods that have been watching over Japan for centuries. Four animal-featured girls have decided to walk the Earth and compete in the funniest strip challenge in human history. Make your purr… uhm, better!

The goal of the game is to have the most victory points at the end. Players get VP by stripping their opponents of their clothes (or accessories).

The accessory token moves from one space to another to denote the state of dress of each character. The possible states are as follows:
1. Naked: The accessory token is off the character sheet and the character is flipped to the naked side
2. Pants: The character is only wearing pants (token on pants space)
3. Bra: The character is wearing bra and pants (token on bra space)
4. Armor: The character is wearing bra and pants, and also armor (token on armor space)
5. Weapon: The character has a weapon, armor, bra and panties (token on weapon space)

The game is divided into rounds, each round is split into phases. Note that some phases are played in clockwise order and some others in anticlockwise order.

Each player faces a round always with 3 cards in hand, drawing them from the central common deck. Cards could have some effects like removing accessories to an opponent (or to everyone), gain 1 accessory, defend from opposing actions, etc.

The cards can be played by the hand, can be held (covered) on the table (to be played during the next rounds) or can be discarded. All played cards form a sort of pile in order to activate their effects from the last played card to the first one.

The held cards go always on the top of the pile, so their effects start first. There's only one problem: the card on the top of the discard pile determines the Seed, that is the color of cards that cannot be played among the held ones.

This is a game full of funny surprises, bluff, ruthless combos and embarrassing situations.

This is a new version of Oppai Go that is stand alone but can be combined with the previous game to extend games up to 5-6 players.

Name: Pet Wars
Description:
Pet Wars is a boardgame for two players that is free to print and play. Players control either the Kids or the Pets. Your goal as the Kids is to keep the house in good shape and keep the pets from wrecking the place. The Pets attempt to destroy as much stuff as they can and make a huge mess. Players only have 10 turns to accomplish their goals as best as possible.

The Pets will consist of four dogs and four cats. The dogs and cats can eat food, then poo and pee in the house, or leave muddy footprints, which all earn points at the end if not cleaned up by the kids. Dogs can break things and chew stuff up, cats can shred stuff and knock things over. Cuz Cats.

The Kids have a Babysitter, Brother, Sister, and a baby. Each kids has a special power. The biggest dog will always protect the baby, and follow the baby around. The sister likes to chase the cats, and can drive them away. The brother and babysitter can fix and clean stuff, and wrangle the dogs.

At the end of 10 turns, the parents get home. The side that scores the most points at the end wins. That's the general gist of it, there is a floorplan of the house, standees, counters and player mats to keep track of your side's abilities.

-description from designer

Name: F-Life: A Card Game About Adulthood
Description:
F-Life: A Game About Adulthood is a dark-humored party card game about life and all of the terrible things that happen to us all.

Each player begins at a young age based on their chosen education level. As you age, you draw many different types of cards that can change everything. The goal is to collect the most amount of money until you die. Once everyone dies, the player with the most money wins!

Grow old as you work and earn money. Get too old, and you'll hit retirement. Ahh, shit! Did you die? That's okay. Continue playing from the graveyard and use cards to screw over the remaining players that are still alive.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplement – Blood Angels
Description:
The Blood Angels are the beatific sons of Sanguinius, the Great Angel. Inside this 80-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Blood Angels in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

- The history of the Blood Angels, with a look at how their valiant defence of Terra and loss of their Primarch at the hands of the Arch-traitor Horus forever changed their fate
- A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
- A Blood Angels bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
- A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
- Rules for units that are only available to the Blood Angels Chapter and their successors – including 18 datasheets
- Stratagems, the Sanguinary psychic discipline, Relics, and optional secondary objectives that define the ways that the Blood Angels wage war
- Bespoke Crusade rules providing new Agendas, Requisitions, Battle Traits, Honorifics, and Crusade Relics that are unique to the Blood Angels
- And more!

You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplement – Dark Angels
Description:
None fight with more grim determination than the battle-brothers of the Dark Angels, and their renowned specialised companies – the Deathwing and the Ravenwing – are held in awe by their allies and enemies alike. Working in concert, the formations of the Dark Angels are devastating in battle. Yet behind their devotion to the Imperium lies a shadowy obsession. Haunted by their past, the Dark Angels and their successors – known collectively as the Unforgiven – wage a secret war for redemption, a millennia-long crusade of vengeance that will either lead to their final atonement… or eternal damnation.

Inside this 80-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to hunt the Fallen with your Dark Angels, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

- The history of the Dark Angels, exploring their glorious rise and tragic fall, and the secretive hunt that has driven them for ten thousand years
- A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
- A Dark Angels bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
- A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
- Rules for units that are only available to the Dark Angels Chapter and their successors – including 23 datasheets
- Stratagems, the Interromancy psychic discipline, Relics, and optional secondary objectives that define the ways that the Dark Angels wage war
- Bespoke Crusade rules providing new Agendas, Requisitions, Battle Traits, Honorifics, and Crusade Relics for the Dark Angels, as well as rules for hunting the Fallen
- And more!

You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

Name: Auntie Foodies
Description:
Auntie Foodies is a fun game about local Singapore food with aunties combined. Compete against one another over a pot luck dinner setting and engage in a food combat! Use special cards to either benefit yourself or sabotage other players.

Players take their turn by contributing food on the play area and let other people consume it. But be careful, some players may sabotage you with the food that you taken. Special cards and condiments are there to make your stomach miserable so make sure to check before you take!

Players will have to consume a total of 20 points worth of food to win the game. If you go over, you exploded and lose the game.

—description from publisher

Name: Scrabble Duplicate
Description:
Scrabble Duplicate plays similar to Scrabble in that you're trying to create words from letter tiles that will score you more points than anyone else — but players are using the same letters each round and not everyone will place their words on the game board!

In more detail, the game includes one hundred letter tiles, as in the original Scrabble game. On a turn, someone flips seven letter tiles face up, then each player writes a word using some combination of these letters on their personal dry erase board, trying to score as many points as possible. You write down the score for your personal word, then whoever has the highest score uses the face-up tiles to place their word on the shared central game board. Everyone else then writes this word on their dry erase board in place of whatever they had.

You then refill the tiles so you again have seven face up, then each create a new word on your board, building off the word already there. Collectively you'll build a shared interlocking grid of words, but you're scoring individually for your creations. Who will up with the most points?

Name: Color Addict Fruity
Description:
The object of the game is to discard all your cards as quickly as possible. Each player has a face-down draw pile and takes three cards from it into her hand. When all players have drawn three cards, the dealer places the top card of her draw pile face up in the center of the table, thus starting the game. Players may discard their cards accordingly if any of the following rules apply:

The background of the card is the same color as the word on the card
The background matches the pattern of the fruit
The word on the card is the same as the fruit
The word on the card matches the word on the card
The fruit choice card is played

Name: Color Addict Drinks
Description:
Do bright colors make you dizzy? Here's the "Drinks" version of the fast-paced discard game Color Addict. Play your cards as fast as you can by matching drinks backgrounds, names, both, or vice versa.... There is no order, because everyone plays at the same time. So not only speed is needed, but also a good eye. With 10 different drinks, such as Mojito, Cuba Libre or Bloody Mary and motifs, the possibilities are almost endless. Ideal for the very late evening or the very early morning... or both! But beware. You want to have a good time, so don't drink too much or you'll get sick! Cheers!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Cardistry Game
Description: The Cardistry Game is a last man standing card game where players must perform cardistry in order to keep on playing. If you fail a cut, you lose cards from the deck you're performing with. If you don't have any more cards, you're out of the game. Last player at the table wins.

Name: Sirtet
Description:
Sirtet is a little 15 minutes abstract strategy game for 2 players, about harvest, sacrifice ... and colorful tetrominoes!

The game is played with 36 custom tiles. The players discard tiles to harvest new ones from the board, trying to collect the largest number of tiles of the same color.

The Sirtet Solo variant allows you to play the game as a solitaire.

—description from the designer

Name: Melvin's Delivery Dash
Description:
Melvin's Delivery Dash takes place in a large county with different areas within it. A city, lake, forest, beach, and residential neighborhoods.
 There's an overabundance of packages being mailed out, but not enough people to deliver them on time. Your goal is to deliver more packages around the county than your opponents before time runs out.

When each player draws a Package card, the package size and color of the card determine where it has to be delivered. Players can move freely in almost any direction around the board as they head to the appropriate destination. When their package is delivered, they pull a new package and head to the next spot.
Landing on specially marked spaces gets you a delivery notice, which can help or hinder your progress, or of those around you.
Choosing the most efficient route, and deciding who to sabotage along the way with Delivery Notices, will influence who wins in the end.

Name: Munchkin: Unicorns
Description:
Unicorns are beloved, beautiful beasts who will stab you the moment you turn your back. Time to return the favor.

This set contains 15 unicorn-themed cards originally found in Munchkin Unicorns and Friends, now available on their own for people who like unicorns but not friends.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Warszawa dwudziestolecie międzywojenne
Description:
The game Monopoly: Warszawa dwudziestolecie miÄ™dzywojenne ("Monopoly Warsaw interwar period") is a fascinating journey to the city, which, carried with enthusiasm after regaining freedom, changed and became beautiful. Outstanding works of Polish architects - modern and functional - as well as the style and color of the then life of the capital contributed to calling pre-war Warsaw "the Paris of the North".

The game is an attempt to revive the beauty of that Warsaw, a story about a city full of contrasts, with remarkable vitality, using the short time of 20 years between the wars. There are nearly 30 objects on the board representing selected Warsaw office buildings, public buildings, universities and scientific institutions, as well as transport modernized in the 1930s. The center of the board is filled with a map of Warsaw from 1933.

Don't wait, roll the dice, make a move, make transactions and make a fortune in the world's first retro edition of Monopoly!

Name: 7 Wonders (Second Edition): Architects Guild Promo Card
Description:
At the end of the game, gain 3 victory points for each Purple card in your neighbors’ Cities
This card was originally distributed by boardgame stores and was also in Plato magazine #130 (November 2020).

Name: 7 Wonders (Second Edition): Gamers Guild Promo Card
Description:
At  the  end  of  the  game,  gain  1  victory  point  for  every  3  Coins  in  your  neighbors’ Treasure (limited to a maximum of 10 victory points).
This card was originally distributed by boardgame stores.

Name: Rad Zone
Description:
Rad Zone is a roll and write, print and play, solo game set in a harsh future where you manage a group of survivors. They live in a Rad Bunker and strive to keep their home stocked with food, water, medical supplies, fuel, equipment and raw materials. They must go on dangerous missions, salvage these much-needed items from nearby locations and at the same time avoid raiders and outlaws that roam the land in their radiation induced crazy. On top of this they must be quick to avoid taking a dangerous dose of radiation.

The world faces a terrible apocalypse. Without warning the sun’s radiation spiked to alarming levels and under this relentless and deadly barrage humanity succumbed. People fell ill, millions died, populations moved underground into fortified Rad Bunkers, all the time the sun pushing the people deeper into the darkness. Many plants and animals perished, and society collapsed. Food and clean water were rationed until people began to starve, and martial law was replaced by irradiated outlaws and bandits roaming the surface in their lead lined vehicles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tin Pan Alley
Description:
Shoot marbles at a tin target three feet away with targets ranging from 5 to 100 points. The player with the highest score wins.

Expert shooter: 500 or more points
Sharp shooter: 250 to 499 points
Marksman: 100 to 249 points

Name: UNO Remix
Description:
UNO Remix features familiar UNO gameplay, with players trying to empty their hand by playing cards that match the value or color of the topmost discard play, but now you can personalize the deck to make it your own and change what's possible during the game.

At the start of each round, you add special cards or write-on cards to the deck. You can personalize cards to specific players, e.g., "Skip to Aldie" or "Draw 2 Chad", you can add a mark to a card to increase the number of cards drawn the next time it's played, you can introduce cards that block penalty cards, and much more!

And as always, when you have only one card left in hand, you must yell "UNO!" to warn others that you're about to win.

Name: PubliCidade
Description:
PubliCity is a worker placement euro-game, in which all players are owners of their own advertising agency, in the first decades of the 20th century.

During the match, all will dispute to make their agencies, and clients, the most famous brands of the region. Play as Abraham, Eli, Henry, or Victoria, and manage an advertising agency with unique expertise.

Offer your services to 7 different clients, and discover the best way to attend to their needs, by announcing on newspaper, outdoors, flyers, or by participating in regional events.

At the end of the last round, the player with the greatest amount of victory points wins the game. These points can be achieved by succeeding in marketing campaigns, building new branches, and standing out at events.

—description from the publisher (translated)

PubliCidade é um jogo de tabuleiro no estilo euro, para 2-4 participantes, no qual os jogadores são donos de agências de propaganda nos EUA do início do século XX.

Durante a partida, todos disputarão para tornarem suas agências e seus clientes as marcas mais famosas e bem-sucedidas da região. Jogue com Abraham, Eli, Henry ou Victoria, e gerencie empresas com especialidades únicas, alocando trabalhadores, fazendo melhorias na agência e usando habilidades especiais.

Ofereça seus serviços para 7 clientes diferentes, descobrindo a melhor forma de atender suas necessidades. Anuncie em jornais, distribua panfletos, construa outdoors, participe de eventos, e dispute os melhores contratos ao longo de um período de 6 meses-rodadas.

No final, a agência com a maior quantidade de pontos de reconhecimento será a vitoriosa. Estes pontos podem ser adquiridos realizando campanhas de marketing, obtendo destaque em eventos, construindo novas filiais, ou fidelizando clientes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Digital
Description:
Lock ‘n Load Tactical system has for over 20 years and has entertained gamers with its ease of gameplay while giving players attention to battlefield conditions and squad tactics from the 1930s to the present.  The LnLT system has set a new standard in Squad-level gaming with scenario-based gameplay. Its innovative gameplay mechanics, unparalleled artwork, historical scope, and accessibility have entertained veteran and new gamers alike.

Lock 'n Load Tactical Digital is the computer edition of our award-winning board game of the same name for the Mac and Windows operating systems.  Players can use digital edition to play along with the board games solo or online.  Players can use the digital edition to enhance the tabletop game, it provides new scenarios, and will also handle much of the bookkeeping.

Lock ‘n Load Tactical system is a fast and furious squad-level tactical game using a quick impulse system and great immersive graphics gives you a true feeling of being there. In LnLT you get squads, weapon teams, armored vehicles, fixed-wing aircraft, and, in the modern-era games, helicopters, and Jets.  As a Tactical Squad system, special skills and leadership are all part of the base game. Single men such as Leaders, Snipers, Medics, Nurses, Advisors,  Chaplains, and, of course, Heroes.  Your troops' leadership and special unit skills can affect your battles by inspiring your men; leading them to feats of heroic bravery and more. Random events triggered during play causing events like ambushes, squads panic, and special support to name a few. Battles so intense that stories can be written about them. It's all here in Lock 'n Load Tactical.

Name: Champions Rise
Description:
Champions Rise is a cooperative card game with light deck building themes. Play cards and use energy to rise, fight, and defeat an endless onslaught of enemies. You will play as a Champion with different and exciting abilities against a Villain whose sole purpose is to defeat you in the most merciless way possible in a Battlefield that can help tip the scales to victory!

The objective of Champions Rise! is to defeat a Villain while playing in a Battlefield as a team of Champions. Each Villain and Battlefield have their own sets of rules that will change the gameplay significantly. The game is won by defeating the Villain OR until the Champions are defeated by having each Champion be Exhausted.

—description from the publisher

Name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battles to the Rhine
Description:
After the break-out from the Normandy beachhead, the German army was on their back foot. The war was now going against them and Allied forces were advancing every day. However, the Germans were unwilling to roll over and still put up a fight wherever they could. At Viller Bocage where the German Tank Ace Cpt Wittman forced the British to pay a heavy price for every bocage line they captured, to the dogged fighting around Carentan, the rapid encirclement of the Falaise Gap. Through the bloody fighting of Operation Market Garden, to attempting to break the Maginot Line and the winter hell that was Bastogne. The Allies would still have a hard fight on their hands as they fought the Battles to the Rhine!

Battles to the Rhine is an expansion module for Heroes of Normandy. Fight 6 new scenarios with 5 maps based on maps from Heroes of Normandy including 3 new Snow maps to reflect the cold and bitter fighting outside of Bastogne in December of 1944. 3 Scenarios focus on British/Canadian forces and 3 scenarios focus on American forces. Included is a new ½ counter sheet of American and British Infantry forces involved in these fights. We have also included new rules and counters that allow vehicles to use Smoke and White Phosphorus shells, allowing tanks to have a greater impact on the battlefield and opening new tactical possibilities for attacking and on the defense.

—description from the publisher

Name: Burrow
Description:
Burrow is a whole series of draw-free annihilation games based on the general concept of capture-templates. To begin a turn, a player takes one of his pieces and captures-via-replacement some enemy piece. Some aspect of the capture provides a template whereby the piece may perform further captures. The template can be the minimal bounding box containing the move, the directions used to achieve the capture, or even the number of friendly pieces in the line-of-sight. Burrow is meant to be a game system and the only presiding rules, aside from the objective of annihilation, are that the template informs all further captures, that the capturing piece must keep moving until it has no available capture according to its template and the mechanism of movement must allow unlimited translation in both dimensions of the board in making the initial capture. Also the game is played on an 8x8 board with a regular alternating pattern of pieces. I invite anyone to put on their designing caps and suggest their own Burrow games. Here are some of my own.

Note: as a general rule in these 4 Burrow games there is no jumping over pieces of any color. However in others jumping may be allowed.

Box Burrow: this is closest to the original. In Box Burrow the template is the minimal bounding box containing the capture with the capturing piece's initial position, and the initial piece to be captured being at opposite corners. A Further convention is that the capture is achieved by a number of orthogonal steps. Further captures can be made, as long as for each, movement is entirely within a bounding box of equivalent dimension and as with the first capture the next piece to be captured is at its opposite corner.

Sweep Burrow: By far the easiest of the variants so far, Sweep Burrow's template is simply the two orthogonal directions involved in making the initial capture. The only further convention here is that if the capture was made with just movement in one direction, you cannot employ a second direction.

Tumburrow: Tumburrow has the most distinctive template of these. The template is to count the number of friendly pieces (aside from the capturing piece itself) a queen's move away from the first capture. The other convention is that every capture must only involve movement in no more than two directions (orthogonal and diagonal) however these directions do not provide template data.

—description from the designer

Name: Lockup: Breakout
Description:
Everyone in Kulbak has heard rumor of secret passages that run beneath the prison. Ages ago, the catacombs carved into these mountains were used to house fallen heroes. Queen Gimnax built a prison over this sacred site during the Great War, enclosing those ghosts and their treasure behind its walls. Some say the catacombs lead to the tomb of Khathandor, greatest of the Dragul warriors. Others swear that the real treasure to be found in the tunnels beneath Kulbak is a crack in the prison’s outer wall. To find the truth, you’ll have to send your seeker to explore the crumbling catacombs by lantern light. New opportunities await you above ground, too, as you influence the legendary characters who inhabit the prison. Strike a deal with Warden Mercy. Make a truce with Masik and his Starlit Door cultists. Commune with the spirit of Khathandor. Gain their favor while you probe the hidden history of Kulbak in search of gold and freedom.

In Lockup: Breakout, players can earn reputation stars in new ways by sending their seekers to explore the catacombs beneath the prison and by dedicating crew to influence the legendary inhabitants of Kulbak.

Gain the most reputation stars over six rounds by crafting items, recruiting goons, influencing legends, and exploring the catacombs — all while avoiding the suspicion of the guards. As in the core game, the player with the most reputation stars wins!

-description from publisher

Name: すべてがちょっとずつ優しい世界 (A World Where Everything Is a Little Kinder)
Description:
The card game ã™ã¹ã¦ãŒã¡ã‚‡ã£ã¨ãšã¤å„ªã—ã„ä¸–ç•Œ (A World Where Everything Is a Little Kinder) is a press-your-luck set-collection game based upon the manga of the same title.

In the game, players aim to either fulfill the victory condition of a specific card they have been dealt or collect one of each type of item cards. The deck consists of 46 item cards, which come in seven types, and 4 light tree cards. On a turn, you reveal cards from the top of the deck, one at a time. With each reveal, you can choose to stop and collect the cards revealed — but if the last revealed card matches one of the previously revealed cards, all of the revealed cards are discarded, and play moves to the next player.

Name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Space Infantry Above and Beyond
Description:
In a time far from now, the 115th Space Infantry Company of the Empire’s Colonial Guards are under attack on colony world Tau 17 in the deep periphery. An alien race is known only as XX1120 has made planetfall and has begun consuming the colony’s population. Added to this, the forces of the Mercenaries have come to bury the 115th, blaming it on this new alien threat. Particle Beams flare and drop engines roar as each force plays for supremacy. Good luck!

Lock 'n Load Tactical Series now heads in the world of Science Fiction adding the Space Infantry Above and Beyond as an expansion game for Lock ’n Load Tactical and fought on fictional hexagon maps based on Tau 17. You will test your tactical acumen as the determined Space Infantry and Colonial Guard advisors of the Imperium, the ravenous hordes of the Flesh Eaters, or the brutal Mercenaries looking to take advantage of the chaos.

Space Infantry Above and Beyond introduces a number of new Support Weapon and Weapon Team variants to the Lock ‘n Load Tactical (LnLT) game system like the Motion Tracker, the special issue M-3 body armor, the M-40 Plasma Grenade, and a host of new vehicles and automated units. These rules will have an icon next to them and will operate in ways completely new to the LnLT system.

—description from the publisher

Name: Downtown Chase
Description:
Downtown Chase is a semi-cooperative, card play, conflict resolution, dice rolling board game where 1-4 players play against the game and against each other, at the same time. Players move around the city streets trying to acquire the right location and the right weapon to eliminate Johnny the Quick – the guy nobody in town likes!

The game is played in rounds. The goal of the players is to eliminate Johnny the Quick (JTQ). JTQ is not controlled by any player, it is the game itself. JTQ moves around the board using a combination of dice rolls.

The players draw cards from three decks, trying to acquire the right combination of location card and weapon card needed to attack Johnny the Quick. When they move to the right location and have the right weapon in their hands and they get close to JTQ, they can attack. The attack is resolved on a separate board called The Assassination Chart, where the players try to eliminate JTQ using the weapon’s field of impact and dice roll.

Apart from playing against the game, players also play against each other. That is why they draw cards from the third deck, with a lot of options allowing players to gain some advantages or create some disadvantages for the other players. If two players find themselves on the same field, they enter the duel, which is a street fist fight. Each player has a particular set of skills which can be upgraded by drawing the right card from the decks.

The player who eliminates the JTQ wins the game. If JTQ is still alive at the end of 10 rounds, victory points will decide who is the winner.

However, each player wants to be the one who will pull the trigger, as they all have some personal issues with our Johnny. 
Looks like a chase is about to start and it won’t be just any chase. It will be the Downtown Chase…

-description from designer

Name: Toppings
Description:
In Toppings, players sit around a pizza and try to get the most points by collecting their favorite toppings, and avoid the toppings they despise!

Players take turns in three phases that consist of cutting the pizza into slices, choosing a slice to claim, and then taking actions that allow you to pick-off, trade or swap toppings.

Players win by having the most victory points at the end of the game. Victory points are gained by collecting your favorite toppings but be careful, points can be lost by collecting too many despised toppings!

-description from designer

Name: Campaign Trail: Timed Releases Promo Pack
Description:
Timed Releases is a set of 21 cards originally created for the Campaign Trail: Second Edition and Green Party Expansion Kickstarter campaign by Grey Fox Games

This card pack contains:
- 10  Action Cards
- 7   Breaking News Cards
- 3   Candidate Cards
- 1    Dirty Politics Card

Name: Turf Legends
Description:
The legends - The sport of kings.

Whether it's stallions or stud farms or training stables for racing. Animal welfare with vets or horses logistics with transporters. It's all there for you.

Name: Effective Detective
Description:
Effective Detective is a strategic card game in which players battle their your fellow detectives in a race to solve a murder. Gather your evidence--hair, blood, fibers, fingerprints, etc.--to thwart your rival detectives and arrest the murderer.

The game is played in a series of six-card hands. Players go head-to-head with each opponent using ranked "Investigation" cards (powered from 1 to 6) to beat their opponent, or by playing an "Inadmissible" card to thwart the other player's card.
The winner of the trick gets to turn up a piece of evidence in their own evidence line-up which corresponds to the one featured on the losing player's card. The goal is to collect a series of 5 related pieces of evidence in your own evidence line-up.

Name: Colonialism to Revolution: Fast Play Rules for 1870-1927 Grand Army Battles
Description:
Colonialism to Revolution rules are designed to provide a simple but thematic games from the start of the Franco Prussian War (1870) till the Italian colonial wars in Libya (1927). 
The rules provide an interactive game that keeps the players engaged through a turn sequence. 
The playing space uses a grid/hex format, but players can easily adapt to a more traditional open space without a grid/hexes. 
Unit bases are grouped into command groups and stratagems can be played during the turn to give a specific feel the different armies. 
Artillery is considered off board and is represented through a sub set of rules. 
Gas attacks are included in the artillery sub set rules.

Ideal rules for remote game play

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Strategeme: Three Kingdoms
Description:
Stratagem is a series of paper and pencil wargame.  The first volume is Three Kingdoms.  There are six regions in ancient China. Twelve warlords and their loyal generals struggle for victory of China during 190-220 AD.

In Stratagem, player writes the commands on strategic paper secretly and reveals the commands simultaneously.  There are five phases in a round.  Recruit, Strategy, Move, Battle, and Victory.  Player has several commands in the strategy phase.  Each cube represents army of different powers. Each command can move 1-3 cubes.  Player win the battle by owning more cubes in one area.

After controlling one area, player gains victory points. Player needs to plan the strategy ccarefully and gains victory points to win the game.
Families: Theme: Romance of the Three Kingdoms

Name: Big Monster: Promo Monster
Description:
A promo monster tile distributed in 2018.

Grassland tile which can be used when the game is played in pair (2,4 or 6 players).

It gives 1 point for each rocky and desert tile of the player and its teammate.

Name: Wir helfen mit
Description:
Educational twist on the game of Lotto. Up to 4 can play. Deal out the player boards. Each board is different and shows 12 images relating to helping around the house or working with parents and siblings.

The cards  do not have matching images as in a regular Lotto game. These cards are shuffled, The top card is revealed by the parent who is 'running' the game.

Each player now checks their board to see if the named card can be used with any pictures on their board. Note that one image might relate to more than one use. For example; Woodwork Utensils could be matched with decorating the house, building a rabbit hutch or fence, and so on.

The first child to give a correct answer (in the opinion of the person in charge of the cards) is given the card to cover the picture related to their answer.

The first person to cover all the images on their card (or a preset number of images matched), wins.

The game was made in the DDR (East Germany).

Name: Poker-Pool
Description: The game is played by dealing each player a hand of cards from the playing cards deck. Each player shoots balls as in playing pool. The player may keep shooting if balls are being made, but creates penalties such as drawing cards for missing shots or making the cue ball. The winner is the first player to get rid of all the cards in his or her hand.

Name: Core Space: First Born – Ships of Disrepute
Description: This pack contains everything you need to upgrade up to two crews with named ships, along with the rules for doing so and pre-designed ship cards for all crews released to date, as well as plenty of blank ones to make your own.

Name: Den galna kapplöpningen
Description:
Paraphrasing from the Swedish rules:
"What is the aim of the game?
To get your horse over the finish line. But, where is the finish line? Well, it can either be the start or the end line.
The direction can change during the race, so the horse in the back could all the sudden be in the lead.
Does it seem mad? Mmm, that's why it is named: The Mad race."

You use a dice, but there are marks on the boards... with extra instructions. There's also a "roulette" for added surprises.
Easy to play, easy to follow... no strategy: it's all about luck and laughter.

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Under Fu Leng's Shadow
Description:
The Shadowlands have always threatened the southern border of Rokugan—but now, the aimless and disorganized hordes of foul goblins, shambling undead, lost samurai, and hideous monsters have been united under a single vicious ruler. A monstrous oni stomps toward the Emerald Empire, leading waves upon waves of deadly foes to breach the Great Carpenter Wall. It is the greatest threat that Rokugan has faced in centuries—and even if the clans can unite, there is no guarantee that they will survive.

The Under Fu Leng's Shadow Premium Expansion is stuffed with 271 new cards for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game, and at the same time, it introduces two brand-new ways to play the game! Almost half of the new cards contained in this expansion are fully dedicated to the brand-new Shadowlands faction, and you can battle against the awe-inspiring might of the Shadowlands using two new game variants. You might choose to play the cooperative variant, either playing solo or teaming up with your friends to take on a mighty Shadowlands warlord. Or, you could embrace the darkness in a challenge variant, allowing one player to lead the forces of the Shadowlands into battle against two to four other players.

Whether you battle the rising darkness together with your friends, challenge them to fight the Shadowlands hordes under your command, or use this expansion’s clan cards in your stronghold or skirmish games, Under Fu Leng’s Shadow is packed to bursting with exciting new content for every Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game player.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Camping Activity Promo Card
Description:
A new activity card.

Add the card to its respective deck and play proceeds as usual.

Name: No Thumbs Allowed
Description:
Players team up and take turns throwing the dice, moving their pawns around the board and completing various challenges without using their thumbs.
Challenges can include drawing a picture, folding a paper plane or molding an item from play dough, and must all be completed while the player wears a large plastic thumb over their real thumb. 
The first player to complete exactly one circle around the board and land right on the "FINISH" space wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stadt Land Flip
Description:
Stadt Land Flip is the relaunch of Speed â€‹â€‹Words.

An addictive card game that takes the famous Categories game to the next level. No need for a pen or paper.

In each turn, a player flips a card, thus having one category, and three letters. Only one letters has a color that matches the color of the category.

The first player that calls out loud a relevant word that starts with the correct letter wins the card.

When only one card is left the game is over. The player who collected the highest number of cards wins the game.

Name: The Game of Saskatoon
Description: Its heritage moment in a blue box.  Classic Saskatoon. The love child of Rich Uncle Pennybanks and a foreign manufacturer.  An early ancestor of Monopoly knockoffs, if you lived, loved, or lounged in Saskatoon in the late 70's this game belongs on your shelf.

Name: Pub Battles: Germantown
Description:
Germantown was Washington’s desperate attempt to recapture the capital at Philadelphia during the American Revolution.

"A very nice expansion to Brandywine. A full on battle using the same blocks. The map is much bigger. The maneuver options are much more open. The British are on defense here. The possibilities are endless."
Editor's issue

As an expansion, you cannot play without units from Brandywine game.

Name: Holy Roller: Catholicism
Description:
Holy Roller - Catholicism pits your chosen saint against the ever increasing hoards of evil washing across the earth. Cast your dice to power your saint with relics, holy water, and other objects to battle each wave. As the game progresses, the number of enemies swell so you and your team of valiant saints will have to work together to defeat the incoming hoards.

Holy Roller - Catholicism is a 1-4 player cooperative game that pits historical saints against a multitude of evil entities. Each player has a pool of dice to draft their attacks and players can find historical relics to help them on their journey. Each round increases the number of baddies based on a flood mechanic. Players will need to communicate well with each other to be able to halt the outbreak of evil.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ages: The History of Mankind – Stone Age
Description:
Ages: The History Of Mankind is tells the story of humanities struggles throughout the ages. Starting from the Stone Ages, players will be able to guide humanity's evolution from small tribes to thriving cities that shine as a beacon to the world. Compete with other nations for resources, technology, and conquests.

Ages: The History Of Mankind is a 1-4 player game where players build the world as they search for resources to feed their people, fund their technological growth, and prepare for war.
Each game players start with completely different goals for their tribes to accomplish and should be kept secret from the other players. Players then use their starting resources to plan out their year and grow their tribe.

Ages: The History of Mankind is a civilization builder that uses historically accurate modeling of the resources, technologies, and peoples so players can relive the excitement, mystery, and struggles humanity has faced. Stone Age is the first of many expansions that see humanity start as small tribes struggling to survive and grow into Iron Age dynasties!

Players will use their meeple scouts to find new lands (hex tiles), gather resources from the lands they occupy, and establish new colonies out in the expanding world. Colonies can grow in power through technology and send out more scouts into the wild to claim even more land and grow into a dynasty! Colonies can also produce warriors to conquer foes in distant lands. The explored land plays an integral role in travel of your meeples, resources available to grow your colony, and provides different resources depending on the season.

As players progress through the years, they will need to plan their harvests, manage the consumption of resources by their citizens, and dedicate resources for learning new technology. Each season brings new possibilities and new ways for you to conquer your opponents!

Name: Remi & Catene
Description:
Remi & Catene, Oars & Chains is a realistic simulation of a naval battle between galleys.

2 beautiful ships collide in the sea. 
Players will have to maneuver skillfully to get into the best shooting position and then open fire with their cannons. 
The damage to the rowers, the hull, the guns and the soldiers will be marked on a special sheet.

But beware, the clash doesn't just happen from a distance . 
An essential phase of the fight is also ramming and boarding.

–description from the publisher

Name: Va a Lavurà
Description:
Va a lavurà is the most Varese board game there is!

You will have to walk the streets of the city and the villages of the province buying property and managing your assets, bargaining hard with your opponents to become the richest in the land of lakes.
The game is simple and engaging, fun for adults and children and represents an original journey to rediscover all the landscape, gastronomic and cultural aspects of the province of Varese.

With this board game, you will travel through the places of the Varese area from the comfort of your living room and you will be able to make the city and villages of the Varese province more beautiful, rich and full of attractions.
The "Balabiott" and "Barlafüs" cards contain dynamics that every inhabitant of Varese knows well: popular expressions, idioms, peculiar characteristics of each place, for an exciting discovery of this fascinating area.

Test your business and bargaining skills by amassing as much money, land and assets as possible to become richer than your opponents and win.

– Translated description from publisher

Name: Match 5 Trivia Game
Description:
The lead player chooses a match 5 card from their hand of 7 cards and reads it aloud to the other players. 
All players (including the lead player) then secretly write their 5 answers down on the score sheet.
Players should have their answers written within a couple of minutes. Install a timer if you see fit.
The lead player reads off his or her answers one at a time. 
Each time a player matches the lead player they get a point. The lead player need only match a single player to receive a point (5 points max).

—description from the rulebook

Name: Blanc-Manger Coco 3: La petite gâterie
Description:
Blanc-manger Coco 3 – La Petite Gâterie, the adult game designed by teenagers, produced by children. Set of 600 cards, including 132 question cards and 468 answer cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Brno šalinou
Description:
Brno šalinou:
The aim of the game is to travel from one place in Brno to another in the shortest possible time. 
Delays, pickpockets or even forgotten bags complicate the players' journey.

Goal:
be the first player to complete his/her route.

Gameplay
At the start, everyone draws a start and finish points.
Then all player try to reach their destination around the city as quickly as possible.
In addition to trying to be the fastest, it is also possible to harm opponents and delay them.

Name: Šalingrad
Description:
Šalingrad is inspired by the famous detective game Scotland Yard.

The principle of the game is simple: a group of detectives moves around the city of Brno using public transports, trying to reveal the movement of the mysterious Baron and catch up with him.

The Baron's movement is secret at first, but later reveals its position several times.

If the Baron manages to stay untapped for 24 hours, he wins.

However, if one of the detectives enters the stop occupied by the Baron, the Baron must appear and admit his defeat.

Name: Fighting Iron: Naval Wargame Rules for the Ironclad and Pre-Dreadnought Eras
Description:
Fighting Iron is a set of wargame rules for recreating naval battles during the era of Ironclads and Pre-Dreadnought battleships covering the time period of 1860 (the launch of the first ironclad) to 1906 (the launch of the first modern big gun, steam turbine driven battleships, HMS Dreadnought) including the American Civil War.

The rules can be used with various miniature scales ranging from 1/600 to 1/3000. 
Rules are included for command and control, manoeuvering in squadrons, sailing and steam vessels, gunnery, ramming, damage and morale.

Ship data for 10 navies covering the approximate period of 1860 to 1900 is also included with the rules.

More is planned to become available for free download from the Rory Crabb games website or Facebook Group.

-description from the publisher

Name: Campaign Trail (Second Edition): Green Party Expansion
Description:
This retail edition of the Green Party Expansion contains voter tokens compatible with the second editions of Campaign Trail from Grey Fox Games.

Note: It does not contain Timed Releases, which were included in the backer game boxes produced by the Campaign Trail: Second Edition and Green Party Expansion Kickstarter campaign.

Campaign Trail is a highly reviewed, card-driven strategy game of electoral politics where players compete to win their candidate the presidency.

The Green Party Expansion adds more action cards, more candidates, new global events, and end game goals that introduce new strategies and allows more players to compete for the White House!

Now playable with up to 4 parties and up to 8 players, the Green Party Expansion allows you to challenge more of your rivals for political victory.

-description from publisher

Name: Witches
Description:
'WITCHES' is a hand management game in which little witches struggle to become a cannabis.

Watch what card the other person is going to play, make predictions.
It's a game where you use your little witch card a little strategic and fun.

1. All players start with one witch card in each color, two fake cards, and three physical coins.

2. Mix the remaining witch cards well and center the 'Great Witch' card and 18 physical coins.

3. There are two more chances each turn for the player to have a witch card before attacking the 'Great Witch'.

4. Players prepare to attack the 'Great Witch' by combining 3 cards with the same color witch card and fake card.

5. Once all players have finished selecting their cards, they will release them simultaneously to attack the 'Great Witch' according to their decision.

6. Depending on the remaining physical strength of the 'The Great Witch', the player is attacked by releasing one or two sheets in order from the pile of witch cards.

7-1. When the 'Great Witch's physical strength is below zero, the player with the most physical coins wins (if the same physical coin, the person with fewer cards) and becomes the 'Great Witch'.

7-2. If all but one player loses stamina, the last player becomes the 'god witch' and wins!

Name: Arkham Horror (Third Edition): Secrets of the Order
Description:
The unquiet spirits of the dead cry out and ghouls stalk the midnight streets of Arkham. Derelict portals yawn open between our existence and the horrific unknown, and even in the storied French Hill neighborhood, the Order of the Silver Twilight plots their path to greater power.

The Arkham Horror (Third Edition): Secrets of the Order expansion brings investigators to the classic neighborhood of French Hill while also sending them beyond our reality into the depths of the terrifying Underworld. Two new double-sided map tiles bring the older regions of Arkham, Massachusetts to life, including the aforementioned French Hill neighborhood, as well as the Underworld itself. Four more investigators join the party, ranging from the steadfast soldier Mark Harrigan to the confident aviatrix Winifred Habbamock. The investigators’ jobs will not be easy — this expansion brings three entirely new scenarios into the fold, challenging investigators with restless spirits, secret cultists, and the depths of the Underworld itself. With over 130 new encounter and event cards, new assets, monsters, conditions, and a new type of map tile, Secrets of the Order opens a portal to a hoard of content, pulling you into some truly terrifying tales.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Hussite Trilogy Adventure Game: Tower of Fools
Description:
Hussite Trilogy the Adventure Game is a strategy board game, in which 2-4 players will test their tactical prowess in a plenty of missions. Explore two game modes (Adventure Mode and Competitive Mode) and embark on a journey in medieval Europe full of fantasy!

HTAG is a board game adaptation of Andrzej Sapkowski's novel series.
